trans-unit.source: Install your StorSimple 8100 device | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Install your StorSimple 8100 device | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to unpack, rack mount, and cable your StorSimple 8100 device before you deploy and configure the software.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to unpack, rack mount, and cable your StorSimple 8100 device before you deploy and configure the software.

trans-unit.source: Unpack, rack-mount, and cable your StorSimple 8100 device
trans-unit.target: Unpack, rack-mount, and cable your StorSimple 8100 device

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Your Microsoft Azure StorSimple 8100 is a single enclosure, rack-mounted device.
trans-unit.target: Your Microsoft Azure StorSimple 8100 is a single enclosure, rack-mounted device.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial explains how to unpack, rack-mount, and cable the StorSimple 8100 device hardware before you configure the StorSimple software.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial explains how to unpack, rack-mount, and cable the StorSimple 8100 device hardware before you configure the StorSimple software.

trans-unit.source: Unpack your StorSimple 8100 device
trans-unit.target: Unpack your StorSimple 8100 device

trans-unit.source: The following steps provide clear, detailed instructions about how to unpack your StorSimple 8100 storage device.
trans-unit.target: The following steps provide clear, detailed instructions about how to unpack your StorSimple 8100 storage device.

trans-unit.source: This device is shipped in a single box.
trans-unit.target: This device is shipped in a single box.

trans-unit.source: Prepare to unpack your device
trans-unit.target: Prepare to unpack your device

trans-unit.source: Before you unpack your device, review the following information.
trans-unit.target: Before you unpack your device, review the following information.

trans-unit.source: ![heavy weight icon](./media/storsimple-8100-hardware-installation/HCS_HeavyWeight_Icon.png)
trans-unit.target: ![heavy weight icon](./media/storsimple-8100-hardware-installation/HCS_HeavyWeight_Icon.png)

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have two people available to manage the weight of the device if you are handling it manually.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you have two people available to manage the weight of the device if you are handling it manually.

trans-unit.source: A fully configured device can weigh up to 32 kg (70 lbs.).
trans-unit.target: A fully configured device can weigh up to 32 kg (70 lbs.).

trans-unit.source: Place the box on a flat, level surface.
trans-unit.target: Place the box on a flat, level surface.

trans-unit.source: Next, complete the following steps to unpack your device.
trans-unit.target: Next, complete the following steps to unpack your device.

trans-unit.source: To unpack your device
trans-unit.target: To unpack your device

trans-unit.source: Inspect the box and the packaging foam for crushes, cuts, water damage, or any other obvious damage.
trans-unit.target: Inspect the box and the packaging foam for crushes, cuts, water damage, or any other obvious damage.

trans-unit.source: If the box or packaging is severely damaged, do not open the box.
trans-unit.target: If the box or packaging is severely damaged, do not open the box.

trans-unit.source: Please contact Microsoft Support to help you assess whether the device is in good working order.
trans-unit.target: Please contact Microsoft Support to help you assess whether the device is in good working order.

trans-unit.source: Unpack the box.
trans-unit.target: Unpack the box.

trans-unit.source: The following image shows the unpacked view of your Azure StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: The following image shows the unpacked view of your Azure StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Unpack your storage device
trans-unit.target: Unpack your storage device

trans-unit.source: Unpacked view of your storage device
trans-unit.target: Unpacked view of your storage device

trans-unit.source: Label
trans-unit.target: Label

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Packing box
trans-unit.target: Packing box

trans-unit.source: Bottom foam
trans-unit.target: Bottom foam

trans-unit.source: Device
trans-unit.target: Device

trans-unit.source: Top foam
trans-unit.target: Top foam

trans-unit.source: Accessory box
trans-unit.target: Accessory box

trans-unit.source: After unpacking the box, make sure that you have:
trans-unit.target: After unpacking the box, make sure that you have:

trans-unit.source: 1 single enclosure device
trans-unit.target: 1 single enclosure device

trans-unit.source: 2 power cords
trans-unit.target: 2 power cords

trans-unit.source: 1 crossover Ethernet cable
trans-unit.target: 1 crossover Ethernet cable

trans-unit.source: 2 serial console cables
trans-unit.target: 2 serial console cables

trans-unit.source: 1 serial-USB converter for serial access
trans-unit.target: 1 serial-USB converter for serial access

trans-unit.source: 1 tamper-proof T10 screwdriver
trans-unit.target: 1 tamper-proof T10 screwdriver

trans-unit.source: 4 single QSFP-to-SFP+ adapters
trans-unit.target: 4 single QSFP-to-SFP+ adapters

trans-unit.source: 1 rack-mount kit (2 side rails with mounting hardware)
trans-unit.target: 1 rack-mount kit (2 side rails with mounting hardware)

trans-unit.source: Getting Started documentation
trans-unit.target: Getting Started documentation

trans-unit.source: If you did not receive any of the items listed above, contact Microsoft Support.
trans-unit.target: If you did not receive any of the items listed above, contact Microsoft Support.

trans-unit.source: The next step is to rack-mount your device.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to rack-mount your device.

trans-unit.source: Rack-mount your StorSimple 8100 device
trans-unit.target: Rack-mount your StorSimple 8100 device

trans-unit.source: Follow the next steps to install your StorSimple 8100 storage device in a standard 19-inch rack with front and rear posts.
trans-unit.target: Follow the next steps to install your StorSimple 8100 storage device in a standard 19-inch rack with front and rear posts.

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple 8100 device has a single primary enclosure.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple 8100 device has a single primary enclosure.

trans-unit.source: The installation consists of multiple steps, each of which is discussed in the following procedures.
trans-unit.target: The installation consists of multiple steps, each of which is discussed in the following procedures.

trans-unit.source: Prepare the site
trans-unit.target: Prepare the site

trans-unit.source: The device must be installed in a standard 19-inch rack that has both front and rear posts.
trans-unit.target: The device must be installed in a standard 19-inch rack that has both front and rear posts.

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to prepare for rack installation.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to prepare for rack installation.

trans-unit.source: To prepare the site for rack installation
trans-unit.target: To prepare the site for rack installation

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the device rests safely on a flat, stable, and level work surface (or similar).
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the device rests safely on a flat, stable, and level work surface (or similar).

trans-unit.source: Verify that the site where you intend to set up has standard AC power from an independent source or a rack power distribution unit (PDU) with an uninterruptible power supply (UPS).
trans-unit.target: Verify that the site where you intend to set up has standard AC power from an independent source or a rack power distribution unit (PDU) with an uninterruptible power supply (UPS).

trans-unit.source: Make sure that one 2U slot is available on the rack in which you intend to mount the device.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that one 2U slot is available on the rack in which you intend to mount the device.

trans-unit.source: ![heavy weight icon](./media/storsimple-8100-hardware-installation/HCS_HeavyWeight_Icon.png)
trans-unit.target: ![heavy weight icon](./media/storsimple-8100-hardware-installation/HCS_HeavyWeight_Icon.png)

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have two people available to manage the weight if you are handling the device setup manually.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you have two people available to manage the weight if you are handling the device setup manually.

trans-unit.source: A fully configured enclosure can weigh up to 32 kg (70 lbs.).
trans-unit.target: A fully configured enclosure can weigh up to 32 kg (70 lbs.).

trans-unit.source: Rack prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Rack prerequisites

trans-unit.source: The 8100 enclosure is designed for installation in a standard 19-inch rack cabinet with:
trans-unit.target: The 8100 enclosure is designed for installation in a standard 19-inch rack cabinet with:

trans-unit.source: Minimum depth of 27.84 inches from rack post to post.
trans-unit.target: Minimum depth of 27.84 inches from rack post to post.

trans-unit.source: Maximum weight of 32 kg for the device
trans-unit.target: Maximum weight of 32 kg for the device

trans-unit.source: Maximum back pressure of 5 Pascal (0.5 mm water gauge).
trans-unit.target: Maximum back pressure of 5 Pascal (0.5 mm water gauge).

trans-unit.source: Rack-mounting rail kit
trans-unit.target: Rack-mounting rail kit

trans-unit.source: A set of mounting rails is provided for use with the 19-inch rack cabinet.
trans-unit.target: A set of mounting rails is provided for use with the 19-inch rack cabinet.

trans-unit.source: The rails have been tested to handle the maximum enclosure weight.
trans-unit.target: The rails have been tested to handle the maximum enclosure weight.

trans-unit.source: These rails will also allow installation of multiple enclosures without any loss of space within the rack.
trans-unit.target: These rails will also allow installation of multiple enclosures without any loss of space within the rack.

trans-unit.source: To install the device on the rails
trans-unit.target: To install the device on the rails

trans-unit.source: With the enclosure on the work surface, remove the left and right front flange caps by pulling the caps free.
trans-unit.target: With the enclosure on the work surface, remove the left and right front flange caps by pulling the caps free.

trans-unit.source: The flange caps simply snap onto the flanges.
trans-unit.target: The flange caps simply snap onto the flanges.

trans-unit.source: Typically, the rails are installed at the factory.
trans-unit.target: Typically, the rails are installed at the factory.

trans-unit.source: If they are not, then install the left-rail and right-rail slides to the sides of the enclosure chassis.
trans-unit.target: If they are not, then install the left-rail and right-rail slides to the sides of the enclosure chassis.

trans-unit.source: They attach using six metric screws on each side.
trans-unit.target: They attach using six metric screws on each side.

trans-unit.source: To help with orientation, the rail slides are marked **LH – Front** and **RH – Front**, and the end that is affixed towards the rear of the enclosure has a tapered end.
trans-unit.target: To help with orientation, the rail slides are marked **LH – Front** and **RH – Front**, and the end that is affixed towards the rear of the enclosure has a tapered end.

trans-unit.source: Attaching rail slides to enclosure chassis
trans-unit.target: Attaching rail slides to enclosure chassis

trans-unit.source: Attaching rail slides to the sides of the enclosure
trans-unit.target: Attaching rail slides to the sides of the enclosure

trans-unit.source: Label
trans-unit.target: Label

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: M 3x4 button-head screws
trans-unit.target: M 3x4 button-head screws

trans-unit.source: Chassis slides
trans-unit.target: Chassis slides

trans-unit.source: Attach the left rail and right rail assemblies to the rack cabinet vertical members.
trans-unit.target: Attach the left rail and right rail assemblies to the rack cabinet vertical members.

trans-unit.source: The brackets are marked **LH**, **RH**, and **This side up** to guide you through the correct orientation.
trans-unit.target: The brackets are marked **LH**, **RH**, and **This side up** to guide you through the correct orientation.

trans-unit.source: Locate the rail pins at the front and rear of the rail assembly.
trans-unit.target: Locate the rail pins at the front and rear of the rail assembly.

trans-unit.source: Extend the rail to fit between the rack posts and insert the pins into the front and rear rack post vertical member holes.
trans-unit.target: Extend the rail to fit between the rack posts and insert the pins into the front and rear rack post vertical member holes.

trans-unit.source: Be sure that the rail assembly is level.
trans-unit.target: Be sure that the rail assembly is level.

trans-unit.source: Use two of the provided metric screws to secure the rail assembly to the rack vertical members.
trans-unit.target: Use two of the provided metric screws to secure the rail assembly to the rack vertical members.

trans-unit.source: Use one screw on the front and one on the rear.
trans-unit.target: Use one screw on the front and one on the rear.

trans-unit.source: Repeat these steps for the other rail assembly.
trans-unit.target: Repeat these steps for the other rail assembly.

trans-unit.source: Attaching rail slides to rack cabinet
trans-unit.target: Attaching rail slides to rack cabinet

trans-unit.source: Attaching rail assemblies to the rack
trans-unit.target: Attaching rail assemblies to the rack

trans-unit.source: Label
trans-unit.target: Label

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Clamping screw
trans-unit.target: Clamping screw

trans-unit.source: Square-hole front rack post screw
trans-unit.target: Square-hole front rack post screw

trans-unit.source: Left front-rail location pins
trans-unit.target: Left front-rail location pins

trans-unit.source: Clamping screw
trans-unit.target: Clamping screw

trans-unit.source: Right front-rail location pins
trans-unit.target: Right front-rail location pins

trans-unit.source: Mounting the device in the rack
trans-unit.target: Mounting the device in the rack

trans-unit.source: Using the rack rails that were just installed, perform the following steps to mount the device in the rack.
trans-unit.target: Using the rack rails that were just installed, perform the following steps to mount the device in the rack.

trans-unit.source: To mount the device
trans-unit.target: To mount the device

trans-unit.source: With an assistant, lift the enclosure and align it with the rack rails.
trans-unit.target: With an assistant, lift the enclosure and align it with the rack rails.

trans-unit.source: Carefully insert the device into the rails, and then push the device completely into the rack cabinet.
trans-unit.target: Carefully insert the device into the rails, and then push the device completely into the rack cabinet.

trans-unit.source: Inserting device in the rack
trans-unit.target: Inserting device in the rack

trans-unit.source: Mounting the device in the rack
trans-unit.target: Mounting the device in the rack

trans-unit.source: Secure the enclosure in the rack by installing one provided Phillips-head screw through each flange, left and right.
trans-unit.target: Secure the enclosure in the rack by installing one provided Phillips-head screw through each flange, left and right.

trans-unit.source: Install the flange caps by pressing them into position and snapping them in place.
trans-unit.target: Install the flange caps by pressing them into position and snapping them in place.

trans-unit.source: Installing flange caps
trans-unit.target: Installing flange caps

trans-unit.source: Installing the flange caps
trans-unit.target: Installing the flange caps

trans-unit.source: Label
trans-unit.target: Label

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Enclosure fastening screw
trans-unit.target: Enclosure fastening screw

trans-unit.source: The next step is to cable your device for power, network, and serial access.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to cable your device for power, network, and serial access.

trans-unit.source: Cable your StorSimple 8100 device
trans-unit.target: Cable your StorSimple 8100 device

trans-unit.source: The following procedures explain how to cable your StorSimple 8100 device for power, network, and serial connections.
trans-unit.target: The following procedures explain how to cable your StorSimple 8100 device for power, network, and serial connections.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin the cabling of your device, you will need:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin the cabling of your device, you will need:

trans-unit.source: Your storage device, completely unpacked
trans-unit.target: Your storage device, completely unpacked

trans-unit.source: 2 power cables that came with your device
trans-unit.target: 2 power cables that came with your device

trans-unit.source: Access to 2 Power Distribution Units (recommended).
trans-unit.target: Access to 2 Power Distribution Units (recommended).

trans-unit.source: Network cables
trans-unit.target: Network cables

trans-unit.source: Provided serial cables
trans-unit.target: Provided serial cables

trans-unit.source: Serial USB converter with the appropriate driver installed on your PC (if needed)
trans-unit.target: Serial USB converter with the appropriate driver installed on your PC (if needed)

trans-unit.source: Provided single QSFP-to-SFP+ adapters for use with 10 GbE network interfaces
trans-unit.target: Provided single QSFP-to-SFP+ adapters for use with 10 GbE network interfaces

trans-unit.source: Supported hardware for 10 GbE network interfaces on your StorSimple device
trans-unit.target: Supported hardware for 10 GbE network interfaces on your StorSimple device

trans-unit.source: Power cabling
trans-unit.target: Power cabling

trans-unit.source: Your device includes redundant Power and Cooling Modules (PCMs).
trans-unit.target: Your device includes redundant Power and Cooling Modules (PCMs).

trans-unit.source: Both PCMs must be installed and connected to different power sources to ensure high availability.
trans-unit.target: Both PCMs must be installed and connected to different power sources to ensure high availability.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to cable your device for power.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to cable your device for power.

trans-unit.source: Network cabling
trans-unit.target: Network cabling

trans-unit.source: Your device is an active-standby configuration: at any given time, one controller module is active and processing all disk and network operations while the other controller module is on standby.
trans-unit.target: Your device is an active-standby configuration: at any given time, one controller module is active and processing all disk and network operations while the other controller module is on standby.

trans-unit.source: If a controller fails, the standby controller is activated immediately and continues all the disk and networking operations.
trans-unit.target: If a controller fails, the standby controller is activated immediately and continues all the disk and networking operations.

trans-unit.source: To support this redundant controller failover, you need to cable your device network as described in the following steps.
trans-unit.target: To support this redundant controller failover, you need to cable your device network as described in the following steps.

trans-unit.source: To cable for network connection
trans-unit.target: To cable for network connection

trans-unit.source: Your device has six network interfaces on each controller: four 1 Gbps, and two 10 Gbps Ethernet ports.
trans-unit.target: Your device has six network interfaces on each controller: four 1 Gbps, and two 10 Gbps Ethernet ports.

trans-unit.source: Identify the various data ports on the backplane of your device.
trans-unit.target: Identify the various data ports on the backplane of your device.

trans-unit.source: Backplane of 8100 device
trans-unit.target: Backplane of 8100 device

trans-unit.source: Back of the device showing data ports
trans-unit.target: Back of the device showing data ports

trans-unit.source: Label
trans-unit.target: Label

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: 1 GbE network interfaces
trans-unit.target: 1 GbE network interfaces

trans-unit.source: 10 GbE network interfaces
trans-unit.target: 10 GbE network interfaces

trans-unit.source: Serial ports
trans-unit.target: Serial ports

trans-unit.source: For high availability, the device requires a minimum of two connections for each controller.
trans-unit.target: For high availability, the device requires a minimum of two connections for each controller.

trans-unit.source: The DATA 0 port is automatically enabled and configured via the serial console of the device.
trans-unit.target: The DATA 0 port is automatically enabled and configured via the serial console of the device.

trans-unit.source: Apart from DATA 0, another data port also needs to be configured through the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Apart from DATA 0, another data port also needs to be configured through the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Identify identical network interfaces on each controller.
trans-unit.target: Identify identical network interfaces on each controller.

trans-unit.source: For instance, if you choose to connect DATA 0 and DATA 3 for one of the controllers, you need to connect the corresponding DATA 0 and DATA 3 on the other controller.
trans-unit.target: For instance, if you choose to connect DATA 0 and DATA 3 for one of the controllers, you need to connect the corresponding DATA 0 and DATA 3 on the other controller.

trans-unit.source: For high availability, ensure that you connect:
trans-unit.target: For high availability, ensure that you connect:

trans-unit.source: Identical interfaces on each controller to the relevant network to ensure availability if a controller failure occurs.
trans-unit.target: Identical interfaces on each controller to the relevant network to ensure availability if a controller failure occurs.

trans-unit.source: Interfaces from each controller to at least two different switches to ensure availability if a switch failure occurs.
trans-unit.target: Interfaces from each controller to at least two different switches to ensure availability if a switch failure occurs.

trans-unit.source: DATA 0 port to the primary LAN (network with Internet access).
trans-unit.target: DATA 0 port to the primary LAN (network with Internet access).

trans-unit.source: The other data ports can be connected to SAN/iSCSI LAN (VLAN) segment of the network, depending on the intended role.
trans-unit.target: The other data ports can be connected to SAN/iSCSI LAN (VLAN) segment of the network, depending on the intended role.

trans-unit.source: At a minimum, configure one network interface for cloud access and one for iSCSI.
trans-unit.target: At a minimum, configure one network interface for cloud access and one for iSCSI.

trans-unit.source: For high availability and performance, configure two pairs of network interfaces on each controller.
trans-unit.target: For high availability and performance, configure two pairs of network interfaces on each controller.

trans-unit.source: See the following diagram for network cabling.
trans-unit.target: See the following diagram for network cabling.

trans-unit.source: (The minimum network configuration is shown by solid blue lines.
trans-unit.target: (The minimum network configuration is shown by solid blue lines.

trans-unit.source: For high availability and performance, additional configuration required is shown by dotted lines.)
trans-unit.target: For high availability and performance, additional configuration required is shown by dotted lines.)

trans-unit.source: Cable your 2U device for network
trans-unit.target: Cable your 2U device for network

trans-unit.source: Network cabling for your device
trans-unit.target: Network cabling for your device

trans-unit.source: Label
trans-unit.target: Label

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: A
trans-unit.target: A

trans-unit.source: LAN with Internet access
trans-unit.target: LAN with Internet access

trans-unit.source: B
trans-unit.target: B

trans-unit.source: Controller 0
trans-unit.target: Controller 0

trans-unit.source: C
trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.source: PCM 0
trans-unit.target: PCM 0

trans-unit.source: D
trans-unit.target: D

trans-unit.source: Controller 1
trans-unit.target: Controller 1

trans-unit.source: E
trans-unit.target: E

trans-unit.source: PCM 1
trans-unit.target: PCM 1

trans-unit.source: F,G
trans-unit.target: F,G

trans-unit.source: Hosts
trans-unit.target: Hosts

trans-unit.source: Network interfaces
trans-unit.target: Network interfaces

trans-unit.source: Serial port cabling
trans-unit.target: Serial port cabling

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to cable your serial port.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to cable your serial port.

trans-unit.source: To cable for serial connection
trans-unit.target: To cable for serial connection

trans-unit.source: Your device has a serial port on each controller that is identified by a wrench icon.
trans-unit.target: Your device has a serial port on each controller that is identified by a wrench icon.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the illustration in the [Network cabling](#network-cabling) section to locate the serial ports on the backplane of your device.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the illustration in the [Network cabling](#network-cabling) section to locate the serial ports on the backplane of your device.

trans-unit.source: Identify the active controller on your device backplane.
trans-unit.target: Identify the active controller on your device backplane.

trans-unit.source: A blinking blue LED indicates that the controller is active.
trans-unit.target: A blinking blue LED indicates that the controller is active.

trans-unit.source: Use the provided serial cables (if needed, the USB-serial converter for your laptop), and connect your console or computer (with terminal emulation to the device) to the serial port of the active controller.
trans-unit.target: Use the provided serial cables (if needed, the USB-serial converter for your laptop), and connect your console or computer (with terminal emulation to the device) to the serial port of the active controller.

trans-unit.source: Install the serial-USB drivers (shipped with the device) on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Install the serial-USB drivers (shipped with the device) on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Set up the serial connection as follows: 115,200 baud, 8 data bits, 1 stop bit, no parity, and flow control set to None.
trans-unit.target: Set up the serial connection as follows: 115,200 baud, 8 data bits, 1 stop bit, no parity, and flow control set to None.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the connection is working by pressing Enter on the console.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the connection is working by pressing Enter on the console.

trans-unit.source: A serial console menu should appear.
trans-unit.target: A serial console menu should appear.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] **Lights-Out Management**: When the device is installed in a remote datacenter or in a computer room with limited access, ensure that the serial connections to both controllers are always connected to a serial console switch or similar equipment.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] **Lights-Out Management**: When the device is installed in a remote datacenter or in a computer room with limited access, ensure that the serial connections to both controllers are always connected to a serial console switch or similar equipment.

trans-unit.source: This allows out-of-band remote control and support operations if there are network disruptions or unexpected failures.
trans-unit.target: This allows out-of-band remote control and support operations if there are network disruptions or unexpected failures.

trans-unit.source: Your device is now cabled for power, network access, and serial connectivity.
trans-unit.target: Your device is now cabled for power, network access, and serial connectivity.

trans-unit.source: The next step is to configure the software on your device.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to configure the software on your device.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to [deploy and configure your on-premises StorSimple device](storsimple-deployment-walkthrough.md)
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to [deploy and configure your on-premises StorSimple device](storsimple-deployment-walkthrough.md)
